title: Keto Garlic Steak Bites & Broccoli
description: Seared, tender steak bites tossed in a fragrant garlic-butter-herb sauce served alongside crisp-tender broccoli. Fast stovetop cooking keeps the beef juicy and the broccoli bright for a satisfying low-carb, keto-friendly meal.

ingredients.notes: trimmed of excess fat and cut into 1-inch cubes

steps.text: Prepare ingredients: pat steak pieces very dry with paper towels, season evenly with half the salt and half the pepper; trim and cut broccoli into bite-sized florets; mince garlic and chop parsley.

Heat a large heavy skillet (cast iron preferred) over medium-high heat until hot, then add the olive oil. When oil shimmers, add steak in a single layer without crowding; sear undisturbed for 2 minutes to develop a crust.

Flip the steak pieces and continue to sear another 1-2 minutes until browned but slightly under the target doneness; work in batches if necessary to avoid overcrowding. Transfer seared steak to a plate and tent loosely to rest.

Reduce heat to medium and add 1 tablespoon butter to the same skillet. Add broccoli florets, season with remaining salt and pepper, and cook, tossing, until bright green and crisp-tender, about 3-4 minutes. If the pan is dry, add a splash of beef broth or water to help steam.
Push broccoli to the side of the skillet, add remaining butter, then add the minced garlic and red pepper flakes (if using). Cook, stirring, for 30 seconds until fragrant but not browned.

Return the steak bites to the skillet with any accumulated juices, toss everything together, and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes to finish the steak and meld flavors. Squeeze in lemon juice and toss in chopped parsley off the heat.
Taste and adjust seasoning, then serve immediately, dividing steak bites and broccoli among plates.
